alert.note: Alert for Clayton; Fayette; Spalding (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 10:53AM EST until January 11 at 5:21AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Georgia... Flint River near Lovejoy affecting Spalding, Clayton and Fayette Counties. Flint River at US 19 near Carsonville affecting Talbot, Taylor, Crawford and Upson Counties. Flint River near Griffin affecting Spalding and Fayette Counties. For the Flint River Basin...including Americus, Peachtree City, Lovejoy, Fayetteville, Peachtree City, Woolsey, Sharpsburg, Peachtree City, Peachtree City, Senoia, Griffin, Orchard Hill, Griffin, Thomaston, Molena, Carsonville, Montezuma, Byromville... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Flint River near Lovejoy. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Moderate flooding begins. Significant flooding occurs of residential yards upstream of the gage between Upper Riverdale Road and Georgia Highway 138. Some roads begin to flood such as Upper Riverdale Road and Mockingbird Road. Flooding expands on portions of the Rivers Edge Golf Course. Several holes and fairways will flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 13.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:45 AM EST Wednesday was 13.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this evening and continue falling to 2.2 feet Monday morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.3 feet on 09/01/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1100 PM EST.
